propertyGroup.name: Outlets
propertyGroup.documentation: Defines the locations to which output is generated.

property.name: wsdls
property.documentation: Specifies the directory to which generated WSDL's will be placed.

property.name: java-types
property.documentation: The directory to which any non implementation Java files will be generated.

property.name: axis-configuration
property.documentation: The directory to which any AXIS specific configuration files are generated (such as the WSDD files, etc).

property.name: axis-tests
property.documentation: The directory to which AXIS specific test classes are generated.

property.name: axis-test-impls
property.documentation: The directory to which the AXIS specific test implementation classes are generated.

property.name: wss4j-configuration
property.documentation: The directory to which any WSS4J specific configuration files are generated.

property.name: webservice-types
property.documentation: The directory to which any extra webservice classes will be generated (i.e. an AttachmentHandler for example).

property.name: webserviceTypesPackage
property.documentation: The package to which extra types are generated (i.e. AttachmentHandler).

property.name: namespacePrefix
property.documentation: Defines the prefix to give to the default namespace.

property.name: qualifiedNameLocalPartPattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when a qualified name local part is created. {0} represents the name of the classifier (i.e. WS{0} would give all your types and services a prefix of WS).

property.name: namespacePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when a namespace is created. {0} represents the package name of the classifier (i.e. ws.{0} would prefix all your type and service namespaces with ws.).

property.name: reverseNamespace
property.documentation: Whether or not to reverse the ordering of the namespace. The namespace is typically determined by the package name of the service or type, this allows you to reverse the package name. (i.e. org.andromda.samples would become samples.andromda.org if this was set to true). Value should be true or false.

property.name: defaultProvider
property.documentation:
The default use given all web services (if not defined seperately on each web service). Possible choices are:
RPC
EJB

property.name: defaultStyle
property.documentation:
The default style given all web services (if not defined seperately on each web service). Possible choices are:
wrapped
document
rpc

property.name: defaultUse
property.documentation:
The default use given all web services (if not defined seperately on each web service). Possible choices are:
literal
encoded

property.name: rpcClassNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use for the class name for a web service using an RPC provider. It's useful to set this when your RPC service has a non typical name (i.e. you want to use the web service delegator from the spring cartridge). {0} is the service package name and {1} is the service class name.

property.name: wsdlOperationSortMode
property.documentation: Specifies how operations should be sorted within the WSDL. Current options are none and name.

property.name: testPackageNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the package name to which tests are generated, where {0} is the current model element package name.

property.name: testNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the name's of the tests that should be generated, where {0} is the current model element name.

property.name: testImplementationNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern used to construct the test implementation name, where {0} is the current model element name.

property.name: arrayNamePrefix
property.documentation: Specifies the prefix to give to names of WSDL array elements.

property.name: schemaTypeMappingsUri
property.documentation: URI specifying the specific mappings from model types to WSDL Schema types. (i.e. file:${basedir}/XmlSchemaMappings.xml)

property.name: ejbJndiNamePrefix
property.documentation: The prefix given to the JNDI name of the EJB provider. This may be specified by another cartridge (i.e. the Hibernate cartridge, EJB cartridge, etc.) so it must be specified here in order to give the correct JNDI name of an EJB provider.

property.name: ejbInterfacePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when determining the interface of an EJB provider: {0} represents the package name of the model element and {1} represents the name of the model element.

property.name: ejbHomeInterfacePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when determining the home interface of an EJB provider: {0} represents the package name of the model element and {1} represents the name of the model element.

property.name: testImplementationOperationNamePrefix
property.documentation: The pattern used to construct the test implementation name, where {0} is the current model element name.

property.name: applicationName
property.documentation: The name of the application that this service will run within (i.e. Security Services}

property.name: wsdlSoapAddress
property.documentation: The location of where the WSDL will reside (i.e. "http://localhost:8080/security-service/services")

property.name: securityRealm
property.documentation: The security realm to use for securing your web service(s). NOTE: this must be set in order to have ANY of your web services secured. A web service will be secured if it has any roles (i.e. Actors) have dependencies to it.

property.name: testServiceLocatorName
property.documentation: The name to give the test service locator.

property.name: testServiceLocatorPackage
property.documentation: The package to give the test service locator.

property.name: servicesPath
property.documentation: The path to the location of the services (relative to the web application context).

property.name: ejbJndiUrl
property.documentation: The JNDI url to use when using EJB as your web service provider.

property.name: ejbNamingContextFactory
property.documentation: The JNDI context factory to use when using EJB as your web service provider.

property.name: sessionTimeout
property.documentation: The number of minutes the session can be idle before timeout occurs.

property.name: xmlEncoding
property.documentation: Encoding for generated XML files.

propertyGroup.name: WSS4J
propertyGroup.documentation: Defines the properties for configuring support for WSS4J generation.

property.name: signedRequest
property.documentation: True or false on whether or not the webservice will expect signed requests. If true, a WSS4J Axis handler will be added to provide decryption of signed requests (if this is set to true the following properties below MUST be specified.

property.name: encryptedRequest
property.documentation: If true, causes generation of necessary code to that expects the request to be encrypted

property.name: encryptedResponse
property.documentation: If true, causes generation of necessary code that encrypts the response.

property.name: signedResponse
property.documentation: If true, causes generation of necessary code that signs the response.

property.name: cryptoKeyStore
property.documentation: The location of the key store file (i.e. keys/authorization-service.jks).

property.name: cryptoKeyStoreType
property.documentation: The key store's type (i.e. jks).

property.name: cryptoKeyStoreAlias
property.documentation: The key store alias name.

property.name: cryptoAliasPassword
property.documentation: The alias password.

property.name: cryptoKeyStorePassword
property.documentation: The key store password.
